text:
<@U033PA64ZCM>, since your website belongs to the category YMYL (Your Money Your Life), you have to be extra cautious with the content you publish from expertise, authority, and trustworthiness perspective.

Besides the content ideation process, my advice—specifically in your case—would be to have experts write, contribute or at least review the content.

It's also recommended that this is highlighted (e.g., this piece has been reviewed by Dr. {Name}) in the content as well.

In an industry like this, demonstrating the expertise, authority, and trustworthiness of the author are extremely important and thus you have to make sure that every piece of content has a "stamp of approval" from an expert.

Try not to get random people to do the writing and make sure that have the necessary background and expertise to talk about the topics that you want to cover.

Last but not least, regarding getting ideas on what to write, no need to re-invent the wheel.

1) Make a list of websites that cover topics like the ones you want to cover (e.g., <https://www.healthline.com/>)

2) Try to find topics that are relevant to what you're interested in using a search operator like "<https://www.google.com/search?q=site%3Ahealthline.com+vaccines&source=hp&ei=K3E9YvehHM6Xxc8PveergAI&iflsig=AHkkrS4AAAAAYj1_Owmun2nQPG9HvDU_4zCgUsQRnOh0&ved=0ahUKEwi349XA4OD2AhXOS_EDHb3zCiAQ4dUDCAk&uact=5&oq=site%3Ahealthline.com+vaccines&gs_lcp=Cgdnd3Mtd2l6EAM6CwgAEIAEELEDEIMBOgUIABCABDoOCC4QgAQQsQMQxwEQ0QM6EQguEIAEELEDEIMBEMcBENEDOgUILhCABDoOCC4QgAQQsQMQxwEQowI6CAgAEIAEELEDOggILhCABBCxAzoLCC4QgAQQsQMQgwE6CAguEIAEENQCOhEILhCABBCxAxCDARDHARCjAjoLCC4QgAQQxwEQ0QM6EQguEIAEELEDEMcBENEDENQCOgcIABCABBAKOggIABCxAxCDAVAAWKI_YIBBaAFwAHgAgAGdAYgBsw-SAQQxNS41mAEAoAEBoAEC&sclient=gws-wiz|site:healthline.com vaccines>"

_*Note:* Alternatively, you can look for a website's top-performing content using a tool like Ahrefs._

3) Create a pool of topics and start creating content

Hope this helps!

attachments.fallback: Healthline: Healthline: Medical information and health advice you can trust.
attachments.text: We're committed to being your source for expert health guidance. Come to us in your pursuit of wellness.
attachments.title: Healthline: Medical information and health advice you can trust.

text:
Hey <@U02TJFU0A3G>! We do this at <http://epiqmedia.com|epiqmedia.com> (just not the boring kind! :wink:) 

A few happy clients we've done product explainer videos for (both for website product marketing and targeted ads, bc yes the format for each of those looks very different):

Loom, Drift, Privy, Hopin, ProductBoard, Dave Gerhardt’s DGMG & ExitFive, Goldcast, Trainual, ContentStack, Toast, Hoppier, DepositLink, NYSHEX, Adidas, TrueBill, FreshMealPlan, Tampax, & more!

Our motto is Don’t Be The Ad. Be The TV Show. For the first time ever, Epiq Media let's B2B brands partner with the minds behind award-winning Musicals, Movies, and TV Shows. So you can create content that converts and that people actually enjoy watching. :pray:

Our writers room and production team combines the best minds in marketing with an Emmy & Tony award winning team who's have also been the minds behind your favorite movies, TV shows, and even Broadway musicals like SNL, Spielberg’s West Side Story, The Tonight Show, Mulan, Pocahontas, Hadestown, Hocus Pocus 2 (coming soon :bangbang:) and more — this allows us to create content 

Our process is full service, from script to the final edit!

text:
I've heard pretty positive things about their usability, I know a company who used them and were up and running within a week.

Not positive on price but have heard they're flexible on pricing for startups and cheaper than others in the market

text:
Hey all - we’re trying something new at Milk and would love to see if you’re interested to join.
_TL;DR - you collaborate with a Slack group of marketers to create a video for your brand, and you get free coffee_

*The details*
Marketers know they should be making video content, but speaking for myself, its hard to know where to start and what to make.

*So we’re running a 1-week video creation challenge.*
We’ll work together on Slack as a group of marketers to ideate, create, and publish one piece of video content. We’ll support each other when we get stuck, bounce ideas off each other, and share feedback.

If you’re in, let me know. We’ll kick off next week — and coffee is on us for our kick off session. If you finish the challenge, we’ll buy your coffee for the next week :slightly_smiling_face:

Here's the form if you are keen to try it out
<https://jzo0ydacujj.typeform.com/videochallenge>
